questions.question: His parents ………………………… when he was a child.
questions.description: Died is the past tense of die.

questions.question: He was declared ……………………….. on arrival.
questions.description: Dead is an adjective. Died is a verb.

questions.question: I ………………………… in
questions.description: The simple past is used when we say when something happened.

questions.question: Let’s ……………………………. your plans.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that are not followed by a preposition.

questions.question: Though she was in town, she didn’t ………………………… a visit.
You haven’t …………………………… for the drinks.
questions.description: Paid is the past participle of pay.

questions.question: She is looking forward …………………………… a grandmother.
questions.description: Write to + ing form after look forward.

questions.question: …………………………. big city New York is!
questions.description: Use what a before a noun + adjective.

questions.question: She didn’t tell me where …………………………. that night.
questions.description: The inverted word order is not used in indirect questions.

questions.question: If you applied in time, you …………………………… the job.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would/could + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If I know the answer, I …………………………… tell you.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.
